The Elder Adhimutta’s Birth Story
“When the Lord of the World had attained Nibbāna,
the supreme one who sees what is beneficial,
I attended on the Saṅgha of monks,
with a mind full of confidence.
Having invited the Saṅgha of monks,
upright and composed,
having had a pavilion made with grass,
I fed the supreme Saṅgha.

analyzed: yam yam yonupapajjāmi  devattam atha mānusa
translated: Whatever womb I was conceived in,🔽whether divine or human,
I surpass all beings,
this is the fruit of my meritorious deed.
For eighteen hundred eons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the gift of grass.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Adhimutta recited these verses.
